instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3462: What is 820-3462? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.R5280: What is R5280? Pullup resistor between PP3V42_G3H and SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SDA which is a data line that allows the SMC to communicate with the battery and the battery charging chip. This line is necessary for the battery to be recognized. With red probe on ground, diode mode should measure 0.441 on pin 2 of this resistor. .
definitions.R5281: What is R5281? Pullup resistor between PP3V42_G3H and SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SCL which is a data line that allows the SMC to communicate with the battery and the battery charging chip. This line is necessary for the battery to be recognized. With red probe on ground, diode mode should measure 0.441 on pin 2 of this resistor. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Left speaker not working (was: Won't Run off of battery after probe slip)
threads.message:
Was performing mic repair on a fully working board, probe slipped, shorting I THINK the left subwoofer amp to ground or to a power source of another line (I was tired).  After removing/replacing both right channel amps the board does not run off of battery but starts up and works normally.

System report sees battery, plugged in, does not charge, and does not run off battery.

CSI P/N and <SIGNAL>CSO_N</SIGNAL>/P all measure right.  <RESISTOR>R5281</RESISTOR>/<RESISTOR>R5280</RESISTOR> measure fine. PPBUS 12.6.

<TRANSISTOR>Q7055</TRANSISTOR> is 12.6 source, 12.6 gate, 2V on batt side.  Is this the problem? Everything with battery connected.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Left speaker not working (was: Won't Run off of battery after probe slip)
threads.message:
Do you mean <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>?
Be sure to tight the special battery screw.
Check if <SIGNAL>SYSDET_3_4</SIGNAL> goes to ground.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Left speaker not working (was: Won't Run off of battery after probe slip)
threads.message:
Thanks, yeah 3462.... my directory is misnamed!

AND ALSO YOU ARE A WIZARD

I put in all 4 screws for the battery, cover included, and now it's fine.  I like the interposer board concept but it makes dumb stuff like this possible.  Thank you again 2.  Has anyone ever bought you a beer for this job?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Left speaker not working (was: Won't Run off of battery after probe slip)
threads.message:
OK reassembled now no audio left channel.  I replaced both amps and the audio codec chip.  I'm getting the chime in the right channel with the same speaker, but no audible sound on the left.   

My ocilliscope shows activity on the subwoofer channel during the chime duration oddly.  I checked the "shutdown" enable called <SIGNAL>AUD_SPKRAMP_SHUTDOWN_L</SIGNAL> and it goes high to 3.0V when the chime goes and returns to 0 when chime is done.

I'll do SMC / PRAM reset just in case but I think it's not muted/hard right balance in the OS

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Left speaker not working (was: Won't Run off of battery after probe slip)
threads.message:
[QUOTE="down1nit, post: 75452, member: 27543"]
I'll do SMC / PRAM reset just in case but I think it's not muted/hard right balance in the OS
[/QUOTE]

Yeah, even tried a reinstall on another hd, smc reset, pram reset, replacing amps again.  I have a donor board that I'm going to take measurements from but in the meantime does anyone have any ideas?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Left speaker not working (was: Won't Run off of battery after probe slip)
